hero.lead: I am a theoretical physicist working in the field of atomic and molecular physics with an expertise in quantum dynamics, open quantum systems, semiclassical mechanics, variational methods.

about.text:
I am a physicist specializing in quantum dynamics and open quantum
systems, with a strong background in numerical simulations, analytical calculations and delving with system-bath models. I am passionate about Mathematics and Physics in general. I am well prepared to teach undergraduate and postgraduate
courses in quantum mechanics, statistical physics, quantum computation and computational
methods. Passionate about integrating research with pedagogy and mentoring
students in modern quantum science. Seeking a faculty position to
contribute to both high-quality research and curriculum innovation.

research.title: Dynamics of polarons in semiconducting materials
research.desc: Polarons are key quasiparticles that govern the electronic and optical properties of organic semiconducting polymers and molecular aggregates. Understanding the dissipative dynamics of polarons in presence of a quantum bath of harmonic oscillators is crucial for elucidating how quantum systems evolve in realistic environments.

research.title: Quantum correlation functions
research.desc: Exploring Husimi-based classical limits for correlation functions and their implications.
